discussion.p: The term "template specialization" is most commonly used as a term meaning "specialization of a template", i.e., "class template specialization, function template specialization, variable template specialization or alias template specialization" (e.g., in [temp.names]). Using "specialization" instead of "template specialization" here would cause no normative change, but make the logic easier to follow. Namely, the instantiation behaviour of associated constraints on functions is already covered by 14.6 [temp.decls], and constraints can otherwise only be associated with templates.
